members.name: Etna Summit Trek
members.description: Guided hike to the summit craters of Mount Etna, Europe’s highest active volcano.

members.name: Madonie Mountain Trails
members.description: Explore oak forests, limestone peaks, and traditional villages in the Madonie mountains.

members.name: Nebrodi Adventure Hikes
members.description: Long-distance trekking routes across Sicily’s largest protected natural area.

members.name: Zingaro Coastal Path
members.description: Scenic coastal trek with hidden coves, turquoise waters, and Mediterranean flora.

members.name: Aeolian Islands Trekking
members.description: Volcanic island hikes including Stromboli’s night-time lava show and Salina’s twin peaks.

members.name: Monte Pellegrino Trails
members.description: Urban trekking above Palermo with panoramic views and historic sanctuaries.

members.name: Alcantara Gorge Walks
members.description: Trek along basalt gorges carved by ancient lava flows and cool river streams.

members.name: Monte Cammarata Trek
members.description: Hike to the summit of Monte Cammarata with views over central Sicily.

members.name: Pantalica Necropolis Hike
members.description: Trek through canyons and ancient rock-cut tombs in the UNESCO-listed Pantalica site.

members.name: Monte San Calogero Trails
members.description: Panoramic hikes overlooking the Tyrrhenian coast and archaeological sites.

members.name: Sicani Mountains Trekking
members.description: Discover hidden valleys, shepherd paths, and authentic Sicilian villages.

members.name: Monte Lauro Volcano Hike
members.description: Trek to the extinct volcano Monte Lauro, the highest peak in southeastern Sicily.

members.name: Monte Cofano Coastal Trek
members.description: A panoramic coastal hike around Monte Cofano with views of cliffs, sea caves, and Mediterranean scrub.

members.name: Bosco della Ficuzza Trails
members.description: Explore oak forests, wildlife habitats, and historic hunting lodges in one of Sicily’s largest woodlands.

members.name: Monte Arcibessi Hike
members.description: Challenging ascent to Monte Arcibessi, offering sweeping views over southeastern Sicily and the Mediterranean.
